repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes #3066
Finalisation of the work in #3080

comment_data.body: `ctypedef_bint.pyx` seems a better name for this test file.

```suggestion
    # test_bool() would silently crash if one of the types is cast
    # to Python object and not just assigned.
    # It happens when a type is wrongly inferred as Python object
    # instead of bint or mybool.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+from cython cimport typeof
+
+ctypedef bint mybool
+
+cdef mybool mybul = True
+cdef bint bul = True
+cdef int num = 42
+
+
+def CondExprNode_to_obj(test):
+    """
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(True)
+    True
+    2
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(False)
+    True
+    84
+    """
+
+    print(typeof(mybul if test else num) == typeof(bul if test else num) == typeof(object))
+
+    return (mybul if test else num) + (bul if test else num)
+
+
+def BoolBinopNode_to_obj():
+    """
+    >>> BoolBinopNode_to_obj()
+    True
+    2
+    """
+
+    print(typeof(mybul or num) == typeof(bul or num) == typeof(object))
+
+    return (mybul or num) + (bul or num)
+
+
+cdef int test_bool(mybool arg):
+    return <int>arg
+
+
+def CondExprNode_to_bool(test):
+    """
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_bool(True)
+    True
+    0
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_bool(False)
+    True
+    2
+    """
+
+    print(typeof(not mybul if test else mybul) == typeof(not bul if test else bul) == typeof(bul))
+
+    # test_bool would silently crash if one of the types is casted
+    # to Python object and not just assigned.
+    # It happens when type is wrongly inferred to Python object
+    # and not bin or mybool.

comment_data.body: It's probably worth assigning these two to variables `resolved_type1` and `resolved_type2`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4929,9 +4929,10 @@ def independent_spanning_type(type1, type2):
             type1 = type1.ref_base_type
         else:
             type2 = type2.ref_base_type
-    if type1 == type2:
+    if type1.resolve() == type2.resolve():

@@ -4929,9 +4929,10 @@ def independent_spanning_type(type1, type2):
             type1 = type1.ref_base_type
         else:
             type2 = type2.ref_base_type
-    if type1 == type2:
+    if type1.resolve() == type2.resolve():

comment_data.body:
If such a test fails, it will unhelpfully print `False`, without any indication for the reason of the failure.
Just print all three values and let the doctest do the validation.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+from cython cimport typeof
+
+ctypedef bint mybool
+
+cdef mybool mybul = True
+cdef bint bul = True
+cdef int num = 42
+
+
+def CondExprNode_to_obj(test):
+    """
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(True)
+    True
+    2
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(False)
+    True
+    84
+    """
+
+    print(typeof(mybul if test else num) == typeof(bul if test else num) == typeof(object))

comment_data.body:
Good point, I thought about it, but since `typeof` uses two words for an object, and it'll be harder to understand what word belongs to what type, so I went the way "nah, I don't really really that"

At least now I'm bit more satisfied with "Python object | Python object"
Done in e21b274c45e7e4c015e0ed9974cc71d45acbd4c8

Will leave this unresolved so you'll definitely see it :P
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+from cython cimport typeof
+
+ctypedef bint mybool
+
+cdef mybool mybul = True
+cdef bint bul = True
+cdef int num = 42
+
+
+def CondExprNode_to_obj(test):
+    """
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(True)
+    True
+    2
+    >>> CondExprNode_to_obj(False)
+    True
+    84
+    """
+
+    print(typeof(mybul if test else num) == typeof(bul if test else num) == typeof(object))

commit.message:
Resolve idependent spanning types when comparing

GH-3066

Add ctypedef bint test

Check that Cython does not incorrectly cast with ctypedef and bint.

Issue: #3066

commit.message: Typing is cheap, reading isn't. Let's add a couple of characters.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix ctypedefed bint
